dt: {bc}a feeling of uneasiness about a point especially of conscience or propriety

dt.t: had no {wi}qualms{/wi} about asking for their help
It was about an enduring secular world where people did unspeakable things, seemingly without {wi}qualm{/wi} and without any grave consequences to themselves.

dt: {bc}a sudden feeling of usually disturbing emotion (such as doubt or fear)

dt.t: I had a {wi}qualm{/wi} of absolute horror, and shuddered; and then the emotion was immediately repressed or suppressed.

dt: {bc}a sudden attack of illness, faintness, or nausea

dt.t: The doctor seemed seized with a {wi}qualm{/wi} of faintness.

pt: {sc}qualm{/sc} {sc}scruple{/sc} {sc}compunction{/sc} {sc}demur{/sc} mean a misgiving about what one is doing or going to do. {sc}qualm{/sc} implies an uneasy fear that one is not following one's conscience or better judgment.
{sc}scruple{/sc} implies doubt of the rightness of an act on grounds of principle.
{sc}compunction{/sc} implies a spontaneous feeling of responsibility or compassion for a potential victim.
{sc}demur{/sc} implies hesitation caused by objection to an outside suggestion or influence.

shortdef: a feeling of uneasiness about a point especially of conscience or propriety
a sudden feeling of usually disturbing emotion (such as doubt or fear)
a sudden attack of illness, faintness, or nausea
